results.title: Hombre
results.creator_credit: Martin Ritt, Irving Ravetch and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Paul Newman is the hero in this exciting, hard hitting western. John Russell is a white man raised as an Apache who faces the prejudices of a society which despises him. He is made to sit outside the stage coach by the white passengers who soon find that their lives are dependent on the man they rejected when outlaws leave them stranded in the desert. Co-starring Diane Cilento, Frederic March, Richard Boone and Barbara Rush.

results.title: Hamburger hill
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Jim Carabatos, Marcia Nasatir, Interaccess, Nasitir-Carabatsos and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Set during the Vietnamese conflict in 1969, “Hamburger Hill” is a realistic, horrific dramatic depiction, almost documentary-like in format, of one of the bloodiest battles of the Vietnam War. The film follows the fortunes of 14 recruits through 10 days of hell as they make repeated assaults on a heavily fortified hill. The developing relationships between the young soldiers is tested by the grim realities of war and death. “Hamburger Hill” is a moving tribute to the men who fought a futile campaign which resulted in 70% of casualties.

results.title: Muriel's wedding (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Peter Szabo and Associates, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and out of place girl who would give anything to be like her bitchy friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bitter-sweet and much acclaimed film which touches the essence of the themes of self-respect, identity and friendship. Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.

results.title: Clueless
results.creator_credit: Amy Heckerling, Robert Lawrence, Scott Rudin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Alicia Silverstone plays Cher, the most popular and glamourous girl at Beverly Hills High. Cher is a girl with a mission; she wants to find a love match for her debating teacher so she can improve her grades and a fashion makeover is a must for her dowdy friend. While she tries to organise everyone else’s love life, when it comes to her own she is utterly ‘Clueless.’ Amy Heckerling’s film about designer clad Los Angeles teenagers is an infectious comedy while Silverstone’s performance is delightful.

results.title: Wyatt Earp
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Kevin Costner, Jim Wilson, Kasdan Pictures and TIG Productions
results.brief_description: Wyatt Earp was one of the most famous lawmen of the american Wild West. With his friend Doc Holliday, Earp and his brothers tried to keep law and order in a land where lawlessness and violence was a way of life. Kevin Costner stars as Wyatt Earp in this epic production and is ably supported by Gene Hackman who plays Earp’s strong-willed father, and Dennis Quaid who is excellent as the sickly but lethal Doc Holliday.

results.title: A Stitch in time
results.creator_credit: Robert Asher, Hugh Stewart and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Norman Wisdom was famed for his ability to combine pathos and slapstick. In this motion picture he is an assistant to local butcher Mr. Grimsdale. During a hold up, Norman persuades Mr. Grimsdale to hide his gold watch in his mouth. This foolproof strategy comes unstuck when the watch is swallowed and Grimsdale has to be taken to hospital. Once there Norman is able to wreak havoc and chaos amongst patients and staff alike, but eventually his lovable charm wins the day and he manages to come out on top. Also stars Edward Chapman, Jerry Desmond and Lucy Appleby.

results.title: A Song to remember
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Louis F. Edelman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Cornel Wilde is the tragic composer Chopin and Merle Oberon plays the radical feminist writer George Sands. ‘A Song to remember’ tells the story of this great pianist, fighting for the freedom of his beloved Poland and inspired by two beautiful women - one who loved him selflessly; the other who was cruel and aloof. Chopin’s life and genius was cut short in the full flower of his musical greatness. ‘A Song to remember’ is a sentimental costume drama and features the skilled playing of Jose Iturbi. This film was nominated for seven Academy Awards and also stars Paul Muni as Chopin’s mentor and nina Foch.

results.title: The Killing of Sister George
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich, Associates and Aldrich Company and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: The erosion of a longtime lesbian affair between a television star (Beryl Reid) who plays the role of “Sister George”, the bleeding heart heroine on a British TV soap opera, and her younger lover (Susannah York). The breakup of the relationship comes about when a broadcast executive who fancies the younger woman decides to write Reid out of her key TV role. The basic thrust of the plot is the gradual development of a rapport and sympathy with Reid, in inverse ratio to the loss of respect for York. The film received an X rating on its release due to a controversial five-minute lesbian love scene. Director Robert Aldrich achieved the look and feel of a “Made in Britain” picture, although most of it was shot near downtown LA. Cast also includes Carol Browne, Ronald Fraser, Patricia Medina and Hugh Paddick. Screenplay by Lukas Heller from the play by Frank Marcus.

results.title: Blood and sand
results.creator_credit: Rouben Mamoulian, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Tyrone Power stars as a matador who started out as a ragged urchin and became the hero of his country. At the peak of his career he succumbs to the charms of a beautiful but cold-hearted woman. To win back the crowd with whom he has fallen out of favour, he risks his all and is fatally gored to death. Linda Darnell and Rita Hayworth star as the “femmes fatales” who cross paths with the matador. This is a lavish production which captures the atmosphere of the subject matter and brings to life the tragic tale created by Vicente Blasco in his novel.

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: Gregory Ratoff, David O. Selznick and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: A tragic but moving love story starring Ingrid Bergmann and Leslie Howard. The great concert violonist Holger Brandt is attracted to Anita Hoffman although he is happily married. He soon finds his love for Anita overwhelming and leaves his wife to tour Europe with her. But he cannot leave his past and his family ties behind and Anita sensing his dilemma, leaves him although it breaks her heart. Eventually Holgar and his wife are reunited as they share a personal tragedy. Sentimental, ‘Intermezzo’ is a great romantic classic.
